[warm] The weight you're carrying shows in your shoulders, [tactful], like someone who's been holding up the world alone too long.

[shocked] Um, I never mentioned the amount or, like, the type of exploit, so how could you possibly, [anxious], know those details unless you, umm, [trailing off], unless you were somehow involved.
[very quietly] Well, you know, before this life I had, um, different skills that paid less but, er, challenged me more intellectually.

[angry] You're telling me that, um, you wrote the code that, [trembling], destroyed everything I spent two years building, like, [frustrated], ruined hundreds of people's investments and you're, well, here serving champagne?

[confused] My advisor hired you to destroy our own project, [whispering loudly], which makes absolutely no sense unless they were, [desperate], planning something bigger. [gasp]

Already done. [chuckle]
[surprised] Um, what do you mean already done, like, [curious], did you actually report them yourself or, well, leave evidence somewhere?
[confidently] I embedded their wallet signatures in the exploit code itself, umm, where any decent forensic audit will, you know, find them eventually. [groan]
[relieved] So you gave me justice while taking everything from me, [contemplative], which feels like mercy and cruelty wrapped together. [long pause]
[sad] Well, I left you something else too—um, a backdoor that only responds to your private key that, like, [hopeful], lets you recover the funds if you know where to look. [cry]
[delighted] You mean, um, the money isn't actually gone and, well, [excited], I can return it to everyone who trusted me? [gasp softly]

[flirtatious] Check line 1,337 of the contract because, um, that's where I hid your, [playful], redemption knowing that, you know, [sincere], only you would understand the reference to your first hello world program. [sneeze]

After everything that's happened tonight I don't know whether to, [grateful], thank you or report you, but somehow I think you've, [peaceful], already disappeared into whatever new life you've, [accepting], chosen for yourself.

[melancholic] Well, by morning I'll be just another ghost in the blockchain, um, but tonight I wanted to, like, [honest], see the person whose code I admired before I, you know, [final], had to tear it all apart. [yawn]
